summary: Drug and alcohol testing is required for certain transportation industry employees. Federal agencies that regulate these industries collect test result data from employers and use it to set random testing rates. The Department of Transportation (DOT) office that collects the data and the agencies that use it take steps to verify its completeness and accuracy. But these steps vary across agencies and haven't been reviewed...
title: Transportation Safety: DOT Has Taken Steps to Verify and Publicize Drug and Alcohol Testing Data but Should Do More
